qas.question: Which months make up the pronounced rainy season in the steppe?
The steppe reaches temperatures above what in the winter?
The steppe is important agriculturally because of what feature?
The mountain climate is found in which part of the state?

context: The plains at the foot of the Sierra Madre Occidental is an elongated mesa known as Altiplanicie Mexicana that exhibits a steppe climate and serves as a transition zone from the mountain climate in the <a3_0>western<a3_0/> part of the state to the desert climate in the eastern side of the state. The steppe zone accounts for a third of the state's area, and it experiences pronounced dry and wet seasons. The pronounced rainy season in the steppe is usually observed in the months of <a0_0>July, August, and September<a0_0/>. The steppe also encounters extreme temperatures that often reach over <a1_0>100 °F<a1_0/> in the summer and drop below 32 °F in the winter. The steppe zone is an important agriculture zone due to an extensive development of <a2_0>canals<a2_0/> exploiting several rivers that flow down from the mountains. The steppe zone is the most populated area of the state.
